xxl.core.math.functions
Class AggregationFunctionFunction<A,P extends A>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.functions.AbstractFunction<P,A>
      xxl.core.math.functions.AggregationFunctionFunction<A,P>
Type Parameters:
P - the type of the aggregated values.
A - the return type of the function, i.e., the type of the aggregate.
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, Function<P,A>
public class AggregationFunctionFunction<A,P extends A>
extends AbstractFunction<P,A>

This class wraps an aggregation-function to a normal function.

See Also:
Serialized Form

          The aggregation-function to be wrapped.

          Creates a new function that wraps the specified aggregation-function.

AggregationFunctionFunction

Method Detail

invoke

public A invoke(P aggregate,
                P value)
Returns the result of the aggregation-function as an object of the aggregate type. The function is invoked with the last aggregation value (the last status of the aggregation) and the next value that should be considered by the aggregation-function.

Specified by:
invoke in interface Function<P extends A,A>
Overrides:
invoke in class AbstractFunction<P extends A,A>
Parameters:
aggregate - the last aggregate returned by the function. When it is set to null the aggregation-function is initialized, i.e., it acts as it is called the very first time.
value - the next value that should be considered by the aggregation-function.
Returns:
the new aggregate.
